description: Complete system to maximize coderef scan capabilities by organizing all 15+ output types into a universal .coderef/ structure. Increases utilization from 2.6% (2 files) to 80%+ (65-90 files) across all projects. Adds missing coderef_export MCP tool for JSON-LD and wrapped Mermaid support. Works for both MCP ecosystem and external standalone projects.
goal: Maximize coderef intelligence utilization - increase from 2.6% to 80%+ usage of all scan outputs across workflows. Enable agents to leverage comprehensive code intelligence instead of blind coding.
requirements: Universal .coderef/ structure (same for MCP and non-MCP projects)
Add coderef_export MCP tool (JSON-LD, wrapped Mermaid, standard JSON graph)
Scan all 5 MCP servers (populate .coderef/ for context, docs, workflow, personas, testing)
Integrate with workflows (planning, docs, personas, testing all leverage scan data)
constraints: Must work for external projects (not just MCP ecosystem - any project using coderef CLI)
No modifications to coderef-system CLI (only add MCP wrappers, don't modify upstream source)
Backward compatibility (existing .coderef/ directories continue to work, adding exports/ doesn't break existing tools)
Performance considerations (scanning 5 servers <5min total, cache results, large files load <500ms)
Global deployment rule compliance (all outputs to coderef/intelligence/, single source of truth)
